{{expert-subject|Psychology}} {{Discrimination2}}
'''Gerontophobia''' is the fear of growing old, or a hatred of the elderly. <ref>[http://www.ias.ac.in/currsci/nov102004/1163.pdf "Gerontophobia, Ageing and Retirement"] ''Current Science'', 10 November 2004</ref>
==Indicators== Ken Dychtwald identifies seven markers that can make up this phobia in chapter two of ''Age Wave: How the Most Important Trend of Our Time Will Change Your Future'':
* If young is good, then old is bad * If the young have it all, the old are losing it * If the young are creative, the old are dull * If the young are beautiful then the old are unattractive * If the young are stimulating, then the old are boring * If the young are full of passion, then the old are beyond caring * If the children are tomorrow, the old represent yesterday
